title: Kauai Trip
name: Kauai Trip
description:
A Map by Daveshaut

Here are some places and pictures from our Kauai trip--

properties.name: Banana Joes Fruitstand
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut52719 Kuhio Hwy, princeville, hawaiiTry the banana freeze thing. You really should.

properties.name: Beach House Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut   5022 Lawai Rd, Koloa, HI

properties.name: Borders Books & Music #95
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut 4303 Nawiliwili Rd, Lihue, HI, 96766, USAAfter listening to local radio stations for 5 days we began to tire of "shaka" and went looking for cds to play in our Pontiac. We bought "Wincing the Night Away" by The Shins and "Not Too Late" by Norah Jones. I also bought a communist mag to read on the plane ride back.

properties.name: Cliff Overlook
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Falls Overlook
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Gillin's Beach Overlook
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut  Beautiful view at the end of our hike that started east of the Hyatt. The hike continues on for a ways--easy, great views. At on point there\'s a sign that says the trail has ended. At this point walk along the edge of the golf course until the trial picks up again.

properties.name: Glass Beach, Chinese Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Hanalei Pier
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Hanalei Valley Overlook
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Hanapepe Art Walk
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut Fridays\' from 6-9 all of the galleries and (a) book store are open for an art walk. It ain\'t no Pearl but much better than I expected. The most contemporary gallery is Time/Space, and it had the most interesting art not involving beach scenes. The used book store is decent--I thought it ironic that I found a used Ohio tour book there. It recommended going to Casa. Nueva.

properties.name: Iravian Temple
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Java Kai Hanalei
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut5-5183 Kuhio Hwy # C, Hanalei, HIHippy coffee place, if you are a trust fund hippy. Drip is .25, Kona is . Ouch. Placate yourself by reminding your wallet that it is an addiction, and you really need it.

properties.name: Kalaheo Cafe & Coffee Co
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut Nice place to get coffee and breakfast. Lots of pastry, good local coffee, good omellettes.

properties.name: Kalalau Viewpoint
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Kauai Granola
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut9633 Kaumualii Highway, waimea, hi

properties.name: Kauai's Hindu Monastery
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut

properties.name: Ke'e Beach
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut  Next stop, Ke\'e Beach. This is the northern-most beach accessible by road. It was windy when we went and the waves were hammering the sand. In a shallow, seemingly protected area someone had written "It is not safe" in the sand. I didn\'t see any freaky children around so assumed the message was referencing the ocean and not some otherwordly phenomenon. The beach has great views of the Northern end of the Na Pali coast.

properties.name: Koloa Fish Market
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut5482 Koloa Rd, Koloa, HIWe ate here three or four times. The fish is great--I had the Maui poke and seared ahi most often. Don\'t skip the mac salad. "The plate lunch at the Koloa Fish Market is a gourmet experience hidden inside a Styrofoam container: roasted kalua pig with sides of ahi poke--raw ahi tuna tossed in soy sauce and spices--and salt-cured lomi salmon salad (5482 Koloa Rd., Koloa, 808/742-6199)" --http://www.budgettravelonline.com/bt-dyn/content/article/2005/10/12/AR2005101201153_pf.html

properties.name: Kukuilono Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Daveshaut  for 9 holes--the best deal on the island?

properties.name: Sunshine Farmers' Market at Kaloa
properties.description: Posted by DaveshautMondays, open at 12. Get in line earlier, though, or all the produce will be sold and you will be tempted to produce-snatch from an octogenarian. Watch out for the hip-replacement checks. The retirees are there to score there mangoes and nothing will get in there way. While we were waiting in the parking lot before they opened the market we witnesses one spouse berating the other to hurry up--the old man was clearly limping too slowly and might be excess baggage in the heat of the market battle. We did end up getting good produce for about half the cost of what the Big Save had, but it wasn\'t a chill experience.

properties.name: graffiti on coffee plantation water tanks
